intro: Borreria neglecta, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and have a rough texture, while its stems are erect and branched. Borreria neglecta is also noted for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its resilience to drought.
